meanings.definition: Not in accordance with fact or reality.
meanings.sent1: She told an untrue story about meeting a unicorn.
meanings.sent2: It is untrue that elephants can fly.
meanings.sent3: His claim of being able to time travel was simply untrue.
meanings.sent4: The rumors about the haunted house were as untrue as a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The idea of a talking cat is as untrue as a dream.

meanings.sent1: The untrue friend betrayed her trust.
meanings.sent2: He proved to be untrue to his promises.
meanings.sent3: The cat's claim of being a loyal companion turned out to be untrue.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt as heavy as an untrue promise.
meanings.sent5: The knight's loyalty was as solid as the untrue ground.

meanings.sent1: The map was untrue, leading them in the wrong direction.
meanings.sent2: His estimate of the distance was proven to be untrue.
meanings.sent3: The weather forecast turned out to be untrue, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: Her painting was as untrue to reality as a dream.
meanings.sent5: The mirror's reflection was as untrue as a funhouse mirror.
